DataElement.preferredName: Head and Neck Larynx Unintentional Material Aspiration Present Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the indicator related to laryngeal aspiration based on the modified barium swallow assessment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Head and Neck Larynx Unintentional Material Aspiration Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the bolus that enters the larynx and passes below the true vocal folds and aspiration.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: For oncology, area of the body generally construed to comprise base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.

Concepts.definition: For oncology, an area of the body generally construed to comprise the base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.

Property.preferredDefinition: The cartilaginous structure of the respiratory tract between the pharynx and the trachea. It contains elastic vocal cords required for sound production.:The inadvertent indroduction of solid or liquid material into the lungs.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: The cartilaginous structure of the respiratory tract between the pharynx and the trachea. It contains elastic vocal cords required for sound production.
Accidental inhalation of a foreign material into the lungs.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to NRG for by script Fri Jan 24 11:30:54 EST 2014

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the indicator of laryngeal aspiration related to the modified barium swallow assessment.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Yes Absence of Signs or Symptoms

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Yes Absence of Signs or Symptoms
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.: Absence of detectable signs or symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
Absence of detectable signs or symptoms.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: Procedure using suction, usually with a thin needle and syringe, to removal bodily fluid or tissue.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
Procedure using suction, usually with a thin needle and syringe, to remove bodily fluid or tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.: Related to the perception of sensory stimuli.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
Related to the perception of sensory stimuli.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
